page.title: 19SKENE HOUSE
page.content: {Skene house}is one of the oldest stone built houses still existing.The square tower can still be seen amongst more modern building.The{walls}were{12 {feet thick}and were built,using run-lime.This was done by building a wall of stones,packing the outer walls with clay to retain the liquid lime which was poured on the top of the wall and ran down through the stones until it came up to wall-top height. {Run-lime}is harder than cement and the combination of the 12 feet thick walls made for good defence from attack in the troubled times of long ago.The old tower was built in the 12th century. Much building went on at Skene house in the Earl of Fife's time;the Stables,Laundry and Gardens were built between the 1840's and the 1850's.
